column2: text
Warrior Culture
Every able member of the tribes of Albion is trained in the use of at least one weapon to be able to fend off the daily dangers of the blighted lands.
Warleader's Guardians
Only the best and most accomplished warriors may join the ranks of the Hearthguard and become the personal guards of Chieftains and Warleaders.
Monsters of the Misty Isle
Many deadly abominations lure in the mists which shroud Albion, ready to defend it from any intruders.
Savage Warriors
Primitive they may be, but their unrivalled wildness and savage might easily make up for the lack of refinement.
Death from Afar
The hunt is part of the daily life of most inhabitants of Albion and the hunters joining the armies have steady arms and good eyes, sharpened by years of experience.
Fast Raiders
Hit before the enemy can defend themselves, be gone before they can hit back.
Trained Reflexes
Experienced warriors of Albion sometimes dodge missiles with seemingly unnatural reflexes gained from the experience of countless skirmishes.
Protective Charmes
The primitive, often savage-looking talismans still seem to have some protective effects.
Warcry
A mighty Warcrie at the right time can motivate warriors to fight harder and with renewed tenacity.
Champions of Albion
Hardened in many battles against the constant threats emerging from the bogs of the island, these veterans have superior skills compared to inexperienced troops.
Deadly Hunters
The best way to kill a foe is a well aimed arrow or boulder, killing them before they even know what happened.
Merciless Barbarians

With a combination of speed, agility and brutal savagery the defenders of Albion often seem more like a wave of flesh and steel, breaking their enemies in the charge and washing them away in a tide of blood.
Defenders of Myth
Druids with magical powers and mystical beasts belong to the most feared members of any Albion warband, and rightly so.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Albion Chariot
Chariot races are a favourite pastime of young Albion nobility - the experience gained serves them well on the battlefield too.
Endless Conflict
There is no true peace on Albion. The tribes constantly fight Fimir, the dangers of the blighted island or each other for the sparse resources. Their warriors don't tire easily.
Warleader of the Sessair
This Warleader emerged from the Sessair tribe and has been shaped by their aggressive, savage fighting style and tactics.
Sessair Warriors
Most of the human warriors of the warband have been drawn from the Sessair tribe and fight in the style unique to the Sessair.
Warleader of the Fir Domain
This Warleader emerged from the Fir Domain and has been shaped by their adaptable, shield based tactics.
Fir Warriors
The warriors of the Fir Domain are making up the majority of the shielded troops of this army, bringing their famous howling shields along with them.
Falian Warleader
This Warleader emerged from the Falian tribe and has been shaped by their way of fighting.
Falian Warriors
The warriors of the Falians prefer stealth over pure might and have little consideration for concepts like honour. A kill with a blade in the dark counts just as much as a victory in a duel.
Finian Warleader
This Warleader emerged from the Finian tribe and has been shaped by their focus on defense.
Finian Warriors
The warriors of the Finians favor defense over offense, often aiming to simply endure an enemy assault and outlast their opponents.
Teachings of the Old Ones
The first Truthsayers have been taught by the Old Ones themselves. Precious little is left of these original teachings, but even a fraction of this magical knowledge is still potent.
Oral Tradition

Truthsayers don't write down their knowledge. The secrets are passed from the master's mouth to the pupil's ear, which introduces mistakes and misunderstandings. This causes the magic of the Truthsayers to be less reliable, but some changes introduced this way have unexpected beneficial side-effects.
Terrors from the Swamps
Truthsayers have mastered the ability to call ever more terrifying constructs of rotten wood, mud and bones from the swamps to bolster their ranks.
Ancient Allies

It is said that the Giants of Albion were the last gift of the Old Ones to the Truthsayers. Both the tribes and the giants have long since forgotten the truth about the Old Ones, but the alliance still holds strong.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Experienced Ambusher
Often outnumbered and outmatched in terms of individual strength, the warriors of Albions are skilled ambushers.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Gift of Life
Dying Warriors are granted a second chance as the spell of the truthsayer mends their deadly wounds and allows them to return to battle.
Wings of Fate
The Truthsayer conjures a flock of magic bird which will fly straight into the enemy formations, bringing doom to those they collide with.
Blessing of Valor
The mage calls upon the gods of hunting and battle to grant his allies additional strength and skill.
Voice of Command
The booming voice of the truthsayer fills the mind of an enemy, robbing them of the concentration necessary to operate ranged weapons.
Mists of Albion
The magic of Albion conjures the famous mists of its homeland, enveloping allied warriors, protecting them from projectiles.
Boon of Courage
The voice of the truthsayer is heard in the minds of his warriors, invoking their sense of honor and giving them unwavering hope even in the most desperate of situations.
Light of Protection
A barrier of shimmering light protects the warriors from magic and flame alike.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Priest of the Earthmother
The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Danu, the goddess of the earth.
Priest of the Sun God
The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Lugh, the god of the sun.
Priest of the Horned God
The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Carnun, the god of the hunt.
Nemesis of the Fimir
The bogs of Albion are always contested. Those who keep the Fimir from crawling out of their holes deserve the highest respect.
Famous Raider
The tribes of Albion raid each other all the time. Those who are successful can gain the favour of their tribe....and the hate of the others.
Killer of Men
The inhabitants of Albion fight not only monsters but often enough they fight each other or intruders from the outside. Some display an outright disturbing talent fighting this type of foe.
Wanderer

Albion is a dangerous land, most of its inhabitants will never stray too far from their tribe to avoid the dangers of the blighted landscape. Those who brave the dangerous wilds and return to tell the tale have the potential to become legends.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Monster Hunter
Dangerous monsters are no rarity on Albion. This esteemed warrior is trying to change that.
Second in Command
A Warleader in the making, this warrior already has the presence of a great general, motivating his men to endure in times of strife.
Bodyguard
If you want to attack the general, you have to go through this mighty warrior first!
Albion Chariot
Chariot races are a favourite pastime of young Albion nobility - the experience gained serves them well on the battlefield too.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Shamanic Warrior
Prioritizing the path of the Warrior, this Wyrd Druid is a better fighter than others - but his abilities to weave magic suffered in return.
Spellbinder
Adorned with similar runes as the famous Ogham stones, the body of this Druid binds magic to protect those around him from the harms it can bring.
Channeler of the Wyrd
There is much to be gained by letting the strange power of the Wyrd run free through the Druid's body, but there is also a prize to pay.
Raven Queen
Wherever Morrigan goes, clouds of her loyal ravens follow for they know that a feast awaits them.
Dubh'neach

Sometimes Morrigan is seen riding a giant raven named Dubh'neach into battle. This raven is the only one of its kind that is known to the inhabitants of Albion, his origin a mystery only Morrigan herself knows the answer to.
Seann'darach
Morrigan is rarely ever seen without this staff which looks like a mere branch of a random tree. But those who know what to look for easily notice that it brims with magical power.
Ravenmother
Ravens will always heed Morrigan's call, even if it costs their lives.
Magical Being
Although Morrigan is surrounded by mystery, there is one thing everyone agrees on: She is no mere human. Even deadly wounds can't hold her down and ravens follow her willingly into battle.
Morrigan's Handmaidens

Every unbound woman may leave their tribe and wander into the wilderness to pledge themselves to Morrigan. What exactly happens to this women is unknown, but Morrigan is sometimes accompanied by grim female warriors of great skill.
Goddess Unleashed
No one knows the full extent of her powers, but all agree it may be better not to see her unleash it.
Experienced Mage
Morrigan wields her magic with the ease and grace of long experience and deep knowledge.
Darkened Skies
Clouds of Ravens fill the skies in anticipation of a feast. Only fools would take to the skies under these circumstances.
Omen of Victory
Morrigan's appearance on the battlefield is seen as an omen of imminent victory in an important battle, her presence encouraging her allies and filling her enemies with dispair.
Staff of Dural Durak
When Dural Durak casts spells, this staff of his own creation twists the Winds of Magic in a way that disturbs the efforts of enemy casters.
Amulet of the Old Ones
One of the last functioning artifacts of the Old Ones remaining in the hands of the tribes of Albion, this amulet can save the life of its wearer once per battle with a surge of magical energy.
Albion Warhorse
The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.
Albion Chariot
Chariot races are a favourite pastime of young Albion nobility - the experience gained serves them well on the battlefield too.
First of the Truthsayers
As the leader of the Truthsayers, Dural Durak is highly skilled in magic and respected both for his wisdom and his leadership in times of strife.
Mentor
The future will be shaped by the next generation. And the next generation is shaped by us.
Friend of Giants
Dural Durak has befriended many of the giants of Albion. They will rush to his aid if needed.
From the Swamps
Druids are proficient in making undead constructs from rotting wood, the remains of unfortunate souls who perished in the bogs and shards of ogham stones, but some are better at this than others.
Druid Healer
Not only magic, but also medicine is part of a Truthsayer's education.
Heir of the Old Ones
Precious little is left from the knowledge that the Old Ones taught the Truthsayers. And most of that knowledge is in Dural's hands.
True Master of Albion
The Swamps itself heed Dural's call and the mists follow his will. He is the true ruler of the isle.
Loremaster of the Lore of Truthsayers
The greatest Druid in existence, no other Truthsayer can rival Dural Durak.
The Circle of Truthsayers
Dural Durak can call upon his Circle of Truthsayers, mighty druids in their own right who expertly wield the winds of magic to aid the armies of Albion.
